name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Sonoma Wine Country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never again will I stay here or recommend this place for those who are wine tasting the napa valley. We were cheated by the misrepresentation and false advertising online. It is not in Sonoma, no where near the wine county. It is literally located to the 101 north fwy near Petaluma in "sonoma county". The room was horrible, setting unpleasant, fitness room was terrible, the coffeemaker was not cleaned out and the list goes on. You get free internet only if you use your laptop in the lobby with some code same goes for printing. If you want to be in wine country do not confused with places that say we are in sonoma wine county. The people behind the desk did were not helpful or at least accommodating for giving us misleading information by phone. My favorite is they advertise Starbucks coffee but guess what it's some pot coffee in some dinky gift store. We were about an hour away from sonoma and an hour from Napa. Ice maker also did not work. Not up to the standards of double tree and not remotely close to downtown Sonoma
reviews.title: Horrible last minute Labor Day choice

likes.disliked: — the distance from the real wine country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend live in Sonoma County, but wanted a little getaway, and due to a Priceline snafu in which two rooms from two separate places were booked, we decided to go over to the Doubletree. I was skeptical at first, with it being in Rohnert Park, which has to be my least favorite city in the county, but surprisingly, it was very nice.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was on the ground floor, and we had a sliding door that opened up to the pool area. The room was immaculate, bathroom was huge, overall, it was very quiet, and the bed and bed were fantastic.
reviews.title: Comfortable enough to return but......

likes.liked: — The view of the pool was very pleasant.
likes.disliked: — Uninformed staff and paying for internet.

reviews.text: Overall, this place got a thumbs up from us.
reviews.title: Thoroughly Enjoyed My Stay Here!

likes.liked: — Coming inside to the roaring lobby fire on cold wine country nights!
likes.disliked: — The food was just average and overpriced for what you got.

reviews.text: It's hard to know where to start with the Doubletree Sonoma Wine Country because the first impression driving up is quite pleasant with a large arched breezeway and Mediterranean feel. The grounds are well landscaped and kept nicely. The room was comfortable with a large bath but there were large red stains on the carpet & desk top. The internet charge of about $10 was annoying. We really enjoyed sitting out on the long common balcony overlooking the pool area but the downside of that was that when smokers came out on the balcony the smoke blew down our way. It was supposed to be a nonsmoking property ? The staff were mostly pleasant but when I called to get directions to the River Rock Casino I was given a phone number to a casino in Canada. I called the front desk back and could never get either directions nor a good phone number for this local attraction. That's when we paid the internet fee. We had vouchers for the continental breakfast but when we entered the restaurant we were told what we couldn't eat unless we paid about $9 each rather than showing us what we could have-- which was cold cereal, yogurt, breads and a bit of fruit. A waiter brings the beverages/coffee. So, it was a mostly pleasant 2 night stay with odd little quirks thrown in.
reviews.title: Overall positive experience

reviews.text: This hotel was very comfortable. The pool was nice.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were large and the bed was exceptionally comfortable.
reviews.title: Very good hotel - good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was not too busy during our stay and we never saw a doorman for the 3 nights we were there. The staff were friendly but could have been more knowledgeable, they indicated that the breakfast buffet was available everyday for $13.95 when in fact it was offered on the week -ends only.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: I also would have thought for a Double Tree that an in room safe was standard but not in this hotel. I would stay again as the hotel
reviews.title: Love the Doubletree!
Last Minute Stay
reviews.text: isn't too far from Sonoma and Napa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid $57 plus taxes for this room on Hotwire and for that it was exceptionally good value.....the bed was amazingly comfortable and the room was large, modern and clean.
reviews.title: Very good value for what we paid

reviews.text: We had in-room coffee and cookies and all was very nice.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Very Big and Hard To Navigate

reviews.text: Somebody wrote that this isn't near the Wine Country..which is sort of true..it isn't near the fancy places in Napa or even further east in Sonoma...however, hop on the 101 and go north a few miles and then West on some of the side roads there are over 100 wineries in the Russian River Wine Region which is right nearby...and a lot of them have free tastings!
reviews.title: Christmas Vacation in the center of everything

likes.disliked: — Internet was not free in your room... about 13 dollars a day for internet.

reviews.text: I went for a wedding in december and we stayed here for about 2 days. This hotel has a very cozy feeling in it, and the staff is very friendly. note to the wise: this hotel only provides luggae trolleys, but they dont offer to take your luggage to your room, and if your room is somewhere n the 320's then you are going to have a very long walk from the lobby to the room. I would advise you to park by the north side of the prking lot, or else you will have to talk alot! overall, this hotel is good, and the rooms are very neat and clean. It's what you would expect from Hilton-Doubletree. There is a Burger King that is really close to this hotel, and there is a spa within walking distance of it. It is right by the freeway, so you cant miss it, and the Petaluma Outlets are very close. The outlets have about 120 stores including Banana Republic, Saks 5th, Gap, Puma..etc
reviews.title: A great stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted a quiet place near but not at major attractions over the Christmas Holidays. We stayed 5 nights and loved the hotel and had a wonderful time
reviews.title: Very nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow- I am not one to complain, so realize that as you read this- Went up to Sonoma for a couple days for my daughters summer orientation at the school, and they recommended this place...Bad choice: We requested king bed : didn't get because we checked in late (we told them we were going to check in late when we made our reservations, and the girl at the front was curt, and didn't really care they gave us 2 queens)- non smoking at this hotel means, that they are NOW non-smoking, but the 'smoke smell' still exists in the room because that "cottage cheese" ceiling is still there, and you can't get the smoke out no matter how much cleaner you use (renovated rooms, but too cheap to scrap that off the ceilings, and oh, the TV's are about 10 years old) Also requested towels because they cleaned our room while we were out running - had to call a couple times for them to bring them to us. The fitness room is exactly that...a room (a converted guest room - thus very small) They also make you pay for wireless internet access at $10 a day, and then no instant check out- you have to go down and check out (no bill under door at final night) AVOID THIS PLACE
reviews.title: Terrible!!!

reviews.text: Got an exceptional rate for 2 nights from Priceline, paid less than a third of the posted rate. Overall a good hotel for your visit in the Sonoma area; good size, clean room. Large parking lot, helpful staffs. We were assigned to a room close to the far North end of the hotel which has a secondary elevator which takes to right to the far end of the parking lot by the tennis court that really helps as it would be a long walk from the main enterance via the main elevator if you are travelling with a 2-year old. Pool area is clean but the pool doesn't seems to be heated so we hang-out in the hot-tub which the temperture varies significantly from day to day. The lobby area was nice, the room and the corridors could use some updating but again for what I paid I couldn't ask for more. As suggested by many fellow tripadvisors, we ate at Hana Japanese restaurant located just outside the hotel which was exceptional, comparable if not exceed some of the better Japanese restaurant in Vancouver, BC.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a good choice when you're visiting the Somona wineries and don't forget to try the complimentary double chocolate chip cookies at the front-desk which are available anytime in the afternoon. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed my time at this hotel. The bed was comfortable, the staff were friendly and it was nice and clean.
reviews.title: An OK place to stay

reviews.text: The Doubletree is a very large hotel and often busy with conventions, weddings etc. The lobby is large and has an area with fireplace and arm chairs. There is internet access, but a charge for printing. The reception staff are welcoming. However, there seems to be only 1 elevator near reception so there is usually a wait to use it. Our room seemed to be on the opposite side from reception so was a long walk! However it was a nice good sized room, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: We thoroughly enjoyed their accomodations! Great Job!

description: With its central wine country location, the Doubletree Hotel Sonoma Wine Country puts you near 300 wineries, great scenic destinations and popular attractions. We are just an hour away from the San Francisco Bay area and 20 minutes from Charles Schulz (Sonoma County) Airport.
